availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Walter Campbell (Hopkins County clerk and soldier with the 25th & 17th Kentucky Infantry, 17th Kentucky Cavalry)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Louisa Campbell. Father of Fannie Campbell and Emma Campbell. Clerk in Hopkins County in 1860. Captain in the 25th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.), which was consolidated into the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from January 1862 to March 1862. Colonel for Hopkins County in 1863. Lieutenant colonel in the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) from April 1865 to September 1865.

ab.bibl:
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0373.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1 (Frankfort: John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1866), 404-405, 423, and 958-959.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 52.
